Tools Docs Community About Code
metadata authoring tools for people and organizations

mdToolkit is a community driven, open-source suite of applications for authoring FAIR compliant metadata

community responsive, open-source

mdToolkit is a community driven, open-source suite of applications for authoring FAIR compliant quality metadata to document data, projects, and collections.

flexible and adaptable solutions

Supports single users with a web browser, or organizations that wish to integrate metadata authoring tools into their workflows and infrastructure.

focus on content, not on standards

mdToolkit guides authors toward robust documentation without requiring knowledge of exchange standards.

manage standards transitions

mdToolkit separates metadata content management from exchange formats, allowing flexible transition workflows - write once, translate many times.

Based on JSON, lightweight and extensible data-interchange content format. Supports ISO 19115+, FGDC CSDGM and other metadata standards. Encapsulates GeoJSON for encoding geospatial extents.

Learn more >

Provides translations between metadata standards. Universal translator architecture with plug-in “readers” and “writers” for supported standards.

Learn more >

Browser based user authoring tool, writes metadata content in mdJSON format. Allows authors to focus on content rather than XML standards.

Learn more >

Masks visibility of elements in the mdEditor user interface relative to user defined Content Standards. Create custom mdJSON schemas to extend and enforce content rules.

Learn more >

Set of support tools, including SchemaViewer, an interactive mdJSON documentation tool, the mdJSON validation test tool, an mdTranslator interface and a mdCodes viewer.

Learn more >

mdJSON codelists extended for community needs.

Learn more >

basic workflow

  • Author creates content using mdEditor
  • mdEditor writes the content as mdJSON
  • mdJSON Schemas provides validation to content
  • mdTranslator translates content in mdJSON format to an XML standard

user stories

documenting scientific research projects in Alaska

The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Alaska Region, has utilized mdToolkit to document research projects in the wildlife refuges across Alaska.

documenting national scientific materials sample collections

The U.S. Geological Survey has utilized mdToolkit to implement a Content Standard for documenting scientific materials collections.
